comment.author: 69267528@N07
comment._content:
A note on the XFV-1 series of photos: "Pogo Stick" was not a name associated with the aircraft. "Pogo" (and, proposed by the company(!), "Pogo-Dart") was the Convair XFY-1, the XFV-1's competitor. 

The XFV-1 never received an official name, however it was proposed by the company to name it "Rising Star" (this was rejected by the Navy as it was, at the time, policy to name only production aircraft types). The nickname the XFV-1 is best known by - applied, it appears, after the fact, but one that has stuck - is "Salmon", after Lockheed's test pilot at the time, Herman "Fish" Salmon.
